content.webTitle: Art of the fail: Trump's healthcare dreams die

fields.headline: Art of the fail: Trump's healthcare dreams die
fields.bodyText: In a topsy-turvy, hurly-burly, gooftastic conclusion to a legislative push that Republicans had billed as the climax of their seven-year-long effort to erase Barack Obama’s health care law, an afternoon House vote was canceled at the last minute. Crash and burn “They own it. This is Democrat healthcare,” Donald Trump said after the failed push. He predicted the collapse of Obamacare. “I never said repeal it and replace it within 64 days,” he said. True: he said he would do it “immediately”. ‘We will do it very quickly’ House speaker Paul Ryan, who engineered the failed effort, said “Obamacare is the law of the land” and promised “now we’re going to move on to the rest of our agenda because we have big ambitious plans to improve people’s lives in this country”. Video: Trump ‘pulled out every stop’ It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. Manafort volunteers to testify
